author: Aditi Ray
title: 12 Sleeveless Kurtis Every Girl Needs To Breeze Through The Summer
text:
By Aditi Ray March 1, 2017 
With winter gone, and summer on its way, we won’t be surprised if you are already rummaging through your closet to find that one piece of clothing that lets your skin breathe during the legendary Indian summer. And what better than a comfy kurti to save the day! But those three-quarter sleeves could be a deterrent. So, we have put together a list of some super-stylish sleeveless kurtis that will help you breeze through the summer. Check out our picks right away! 
1. Pink cotton kurti 
This lightweight kurti in refreshing pink is a great choice for summers. You can wear it to work, a casual outing and even when you are stepping out for some grocery shopping. Keep your look simple with a pair of silver hoop earrings and a pair of heels. 
2. Digital print crepe kurti 
With the cool colour palette, this lovely kurti here is like a breath of fresh air in your summer closet. Team this kurti with leggings and white flats for a casual office look this Friday. 
3. Printed multi-colour kurti 
This printed kurti here is the cutest thing we have seen yet. With lovely cherry blossom prints, this simple piece in beige and pink is great for everyday use or casual outings. Team it up with a pair of pink leggings and a pair of peep toes. Perfect the look with a pair of silver drop earrings and a dash of matching lipcolour. 
4. Printed jacket kurti 
This smart sleeveless maroon kurti with a black foliage print jacket is a good idea for work wear. This simple and no-nonsense style will go very well with leggings as well as slim fit palazzo pants. A pair of ethnic juttis or nude heels will top off the look perfectly. Stick to minimum accessories with just a pair of simple chandbalis to go with the look. 
5. Pink Ikat print kurti 
Ikat prints are the coolest thing in fashion this season. From runway to daily wear, Ikat prints are making waves everywhere. And this chic kurti with a side patch of Ikat print in combinations of pink and grey is totally worth crushing on. Pick this one, and you are all set for your next movie date with friends or a casual outing. 
6. Blue zari work kurti 
Here’s one for summer weddings or parties. No more sweating it out in those heavy lehengas or anarkalis. This sleeveless Chanderi kurti with detailed zari work is a lifesaver. It’s elegant, stylish and also takes care of your summer style needs. Our recommendation: Get this piece as soon as you can. 
7. Yellow Chanderi kurti 
A bright and happy number, this yellow short kurti can be worn everyday as well as to parties! Pair it with denims or a pair of leggings as per the occasion. A pair of matching hoop earrings is just the accessory you need to team it with. 
8. Black and orange kurti 
A great blend of trendy colours with traditional silhouette, this black kurti is chic and smart. You can wear it to work or double it up as a dress for a friend’s cocktail party as well! A pair of silver earrings is all you need to complete this chic look. 
9. Maroon and black Ikat print kurti 
A classic combination of black and maroon, this kurti is a great addition to your summer closet. With trendy cuts and a patch of gorgeous Ikat prints, it makes for a great pick for office wear. A matching clutch and a pair of subtle earrings is everything you need to make this look work. 
10. Printed short kurti 
We are totally in love with this short printed kurti! But you can’t blame us; the cool play of colours and those ballerina prints are just too good to resist. Wear it with denims, leggings or skirts for a chilled out look this summer. 
11. Yellow cotton kurti 
Simply beautiful, this one should be a part of every girl’s wardrobe. The warm colours and paisley prints alone make it a total winner. You can pair it with leggings, skirts or patialas for a stylish look this summer. 
12. Grey straight kurti 
Classy and sophisticated, this grey kurti with Peter Pan collar is a great pick for office wear. Wear it with a pair of leggings and peep toes to nail the formal look. Just a dash of nude lipcolour and a pair of simple hoop earrings, and you are good to go!
